Title: Korean I
Description: Introductory Korean. Includes listening, speaking and writing, with individual audio-video practice.

Title: Korean II
Description: Introductory Korean. Includes listening, speaking and writing, with individual audio-video practice. Builds on Korean 101.

Title: Korean III
Description: Introductory Korean. Includes listening, speaking and writing, with individual audio-video practice. Builds on Korean 102.

Title: Korean IV
Description: This course includes listening, speaking, reading, and writing practice, with a focus on cultural competency and conversational skills. Builds onKOR 103.

Title: Korean V
Description: This course includes listening, speaking, reading, and writing practice, with a focus on cultural competency and conversational skills. Builds onKOR 201.

Title: Advanced Writing & Speaking
Description: Provides advanced practice in written and oral communication, including journalistic, professional, and creative writing. Examines contemporary cultural contexts through media and news. Taught in Korean.

Title: Introduction to Language for the Professions
Description: Introduction to communication skills in areas such as contemporary business, health, and law in a culturally sensitive fashion. Taught in Korean.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 27 credits

Title: Introduction to Language, Media, and Society
Description: Introduction to the role of language and media in society, including sociolinguistics, gender, media studies, and communication. Taught in Korean.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 27 credits

Title: Advanced Grammar and Translation
Description: Provides advanced grammar instruction and fosters translation and communication skills within a contemporary cultural context. Taught in Korean.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 27 credits

Title: Advanced Studies in Language for the Professions
Description: Advanced communication skills in areas such as contemporary business, health, and law in a culturally sensitive fashion. Taught in Korean.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 27 credits

Title: Advanced Topics in Language, Media, and Society
Description: Advanced analysis of the role of language and media in society, including sociolinguistics, gender, media studies, and communication. Taught in Korean. Topics will vary according to the instructor's expertise.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 27 credits

Title: Independent Study in KOR
Description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
